abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Social Action Project in
            Burundi entails construction of schools, health facilities,
            and minor related construction works concerning water
            supply, as well as small scale reforestation, aimed at
            improving the livelihoods of local populations.
            Nevertheless, these improvements may potentially endanger
            the environment, due to soil erosion, inadequate drainage
            systems, sedimentation - potentially contaminating water
            sources, with adverse impacts on natural habitats.
            Mitigation measures call for: construction works to be
            conducted during the dry season as possible, to control
            erosion, and surface water contamination; careful attention
            on adequate drainage systems - located as close as possible
            to pumping stations - to control, and prevent soil erosion
            and water contamination; in particular, hazardous materials,
            including biomedical wastes, should follow strict standard
            guidelines - collection/treatment, storage, and disposal at
            appropriate sites - to prevent soil, and water pollution;
            limited daytime working schedules to abate noise
            disturbances; minimizing natural vegetation losses during
            construction, and, include vegetative propagation following
            construction, specifically with native species; appropriate
            maintenance, and cleaning of construction sites, including
            water spraying, to control dust emissions and air quality;
            and, particular attention to site selection, in an aim to
            protect natural habitats, agricultural lands, and regional
            water uses.
